resources.string: We use mindful Pomodoro cycles, gentle cues, and environmental sensing to keep your focus energy high.
Add a friendly face and a few focus goals so we can cheer you on.
Don\'t have the right photo yet? You can always update it later.
What project or habits do you want to focus on?
Start with 25 minutes to follow the classic Pomodoro technique.
Add tags to label each study session (e.g. Algorithms, UX Research, Physics).
Tell us what you want to focus on.
Use a positive number of minutes.
Create at least one tag to track your sessions.
You need to pick a color to create a tag.
MindBricks learns based on ambient noise and light environment during study sessions.
We only listen for noise levels during your sessions to understand in what environment you are.
Allow microphone access so we can track noise during sessions, even when the screen is off. If you selected “Allow only while using”, switch to “Allow” in system settings.
Ambient light data helps us understand if you are more productive in the dark, or in the bright.
Light sensor unavailable on this device
Light sensor enabled. We’ll read ambient light during sessions.
You chose “Don’t allow”. To keep reading noise during sessions (even with the screen off), enable microphone for MindBricks in system Settings.
We use the significant motion sensor to detect when you lift or move the phone during focus sessions.
Pick-up detection unavailable on this device
Enable notifications so we can remind you to start, pause, and celebrate focus sessions.
Notifications are off. Enable them in system Settings to get reminders.
Enable reminders so MindBricks can nudge you to start, pause, and celebrate after each focus session.
You can change this preference later in Settings.
You have everything set. When you tap Start we\'ll open your focus dashboard.
Add your name so we can personalize your coaching.
Use a real name (letters, accents, spaces, & allowed).
Use letters/numbers with simple punctuation for tag names.
